text: Fredrick "Fred" William Draper (July 22, 1868 - September 2, 1962) was an American politician and educator. Born in Dundee, Fond du Lac County, Wisconsin, in the town of Osceola, Draper moved with his parents to Loyal, Clark County, Wisconsin. Draper went to the Loyal Public Schools and then to Oshkosh Normal School (now University of Wisconsin-Oshkosh). Clark taught school in Clark County. From 1901 to 1911, Draper was Clark County Circuit Court Clerk and was a Republican. He also served on the school board and was justice of the peace. In 1911, Draper served in the Wisconsin State Assembly.Wisconsin Blue Book, 1911, Biographical Sketch of F. W. Draper, p. 754. Draper moved to Greensboro, North Carolina to live with his daughter. He died in Greensboro and was buried in his hometown of Loyal.Fred W. Draper obituary, Clark County Press (Neillsville, Wisconsin), September 13, 1962. ==Notes== ==External links== * Category:1868 births Category:1962 deaths Category:Politicians from Greensboro, North Carolina Category:People from Loyal, Wisconsin Category:People from Osceola, Fond du Lac County, Wisconsin Category:University of Wisconsin-Oshkosh alumni Category:Educators from Wisconsin Category:Wisconsin Republicans Category:School board members in Wisconsin Category:Members of the Wisconsin State Assembly
title: Fred W. Draper
